src:
Protest: Spasimo Savski most, otpor zagadjenju kulture i vazduha

02 Nov 2019, 17:20

Učesnici protesta Jedan od pet miliona pozvani su večeras, na skupu u Beogradu, da 15. novembra dodju u Bor i podrže gradjane koji se tamo bore protiv zagadjenja vazduha.Na početku skupa pod sloganom "protiv zagadjenja vazduha i kulture", na platou kod Filozofskog fakulteta učesnica protesta u Boru Irena Živković rekla je da u tom gradu nije u toku "zagadjenje već zločin", i pozvala Beogradjane da dodju i pruže podršku, istakavši da se odgovorni ne plaše krivičnih prijava već gradjana okupljenih na ulici.Ona je navela da rukovodstvio RTB Bor ne dozvoljava radnicima da se pridruže prostestima protiv zagadjenja vazduha u tom gradu, i dodala da je "ugovor o RTB-u izdaja Bora".Živković je precizirala da će krivičnu prijavu učesnici protesta podneti protiv zagadjivača, gradonačelnika Bora Aleksandra Milikića i ministra Gorana Trivana koji je, kako je kazala, "stao u zaštitu stranog investitora, a ne gradjana".Ona je rekla da je u Boru zabeležena nekoliko desetina, pa i stotina veća koncentracija štetnih materija u vazduhu od dozvoljene.Student Fakulteta organizacionih nauka (FON) Moma Kovačević rekao je da dekan FON-a Milija Suknović nije dopustio da se, po predlogu profesora, glasa o tome da li je doktorat ministra finansija Siniše Malog plagijat.On je dekanu poručio da taj rad jeste plagijat.Prema njegovim rečima, protesti na ulici daju rezultate i njihove učesnike ne može niko zastrašiti."Bojkotovaćemo cirkus koji vlast naziva izborima. Hoćemo bojkot", naglasio je Kovačević.Nakon obraćanja sa platoa kod Filozofskog fakulteta, krenula je protestna šetnja koja se zaustavila kod zgrade Vlade.Studentkinja Tea Vukadin, iz organizacije protesta, rekla je da je zbog vlade u kojoj je bio predsednik Srbije Aleksandar Vučić Srbija bombardovana.Pokazujući na obližnju zgradu Generalštaba, na kojoj se vide tragovi bombardovanja, ona je rekla da se u tim ruševinama vidi potpis Vučića.Prema njenim rečima, Marinika Tepić je nedavno pokrenula pitanje da li ćemo ponovo biti bombardovani zbog njegove vlade."Da li će, Vučiću, zbog tvojih granata, one padati i kod nas", rekla je Vukadinović koja je zatim zapevala pesmu Dordja Balaševića "Samo da rata ne bude", prethodno emitovanu sa zvučnika.Protestna šetnja završena je na Savskom mostu, a organizatori okupljanja poručili su da neće dozvoliti vlastima da ga sruše.Student Miodrag Simović, jedan od organizatora protesta", rekao je da naprednjačka vlast pokušava da uradi ono što ni okupatoru nije uspelo i time pokazuje da je i ona okupatorska".On je podsetio da je 1944. okupator onemogućen da minira most, kao i da su gradjani sačuvali mostove 1999. godine.Prema njegovim rečima, planovi vlasti sa tim mostom pokazuju da je ona potpuno diletantska."Bojkotovaćemo izbore ove vlasti, pobedićemo, Srbija se umiriti ne može", rekao je Simović.Sledeće okupljanje zakazano je za narednu subotu.
text:
Protest: Save the Sava Bridge, resistance to pollution of culture and air

02 Nov 2019, 16:20

Protesters One in five million were invited to come to Bor on November 15 at a rally in Belgrade to support citizens fighting air pollution there. At the start of the rally, under the slogan "against air and culture pollution", on the plateau at the Philosophical Faculty of protest participants in Bor Irena Zivkovic said that "pollution is not a crime in progress" in the city, and called on Belgrade residents to come and give support, noting that those responsible are not afraid of criminal charges but citizens gathered on the street. RTB Bor does not allow workers to join in the prostitution against air pollution in the city, adding that "the RTB contract is a betrayal of Bor." Zivkovic specified that the protesters would file criminal charges against polluters, Bor Mayor Alexander Milikic and Minister Goran Trivana, who, she said, "stood for the protection of a foreign investor, not a citizen." She said several dozen were recorded in Bor. even hundreds of higher concentrations of harmful substances in the air than allowed. Student of the Faculty of Organizational Sciences (FON) Moma Kovacevic said that the FON Dean Milija Suknovic did not allow, according to the professor's proposal, to vote on whether the doctorate of Finance Minister Sinisa Mali plagiarism.He told the dean that the work was plagiarism. According to him, protests on the street produce results and no one can be intimidated by their participants. "We will boycott the circus, which the authorities call elections. We want a boycott, "Kovacevic emphasized. After addressing the plateau at the Faculty of Philosophy, a protest walk began that stopped at the Government building. Pointing to a nearby building of the General Staff, which shows traces of the bombing, she said that those ruins could see Vucic's signature. According to her, Marinika Tepic recently raised the question of whether we would be bombed again because of his government. because of your shells, Vucic, they will fall with us as well, "said Vukadinovic, who then sang a song by Dordj Balasevic" Just so there will be no war "previously broadcast from the loudspeakers. are that they will not allow the authorities to overthrow him. Student Miodrag Simovic, one of the organizers of the protests, "said the advancing government was trying He did recall that in 1944 the occupier was prevented from mining the bridge, and that the townspeople preserved the bridges in 1999. According to him, government plans with "They will boycott the elections of this government, we will win, Serbia cannot be reconciled," Simovic said. The next gathering is scheduled for next Saturday.
